text: rline - Malar flattening - Microvesicular hepatic steatosis - Muscular hypotonia - Peripheral demyelination - Prominent forehead - Strabismus - Tachypnea - Tremor - Wide nasal bridge - The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) has collected information on how often a sign or symptom occurs in a condition. Much of this information comes from Orphanet, a European rare disease database. The frequency of a sign or symptom is usually listed as a rough estimate of the percentage of patients who have that fea
